Full Mechanism of Action (MOA): Inhibits the conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, causing vasodilation and reduction in the release of aldosterone.
Inhibits the influx of calcium ions into vascular smooth muscle and cardiac muscle, resulting in decreased peripheral vascular resistance and reduced blood pressure.
Selectively blocks the binding of angiotensin II to the AT1 receptor, preventing vasoconstriction and reducing the secretion of aldosterone.
Inhibits sodium reabsorption in the distal tubules causing increased excretion of sodium and water, as well as potassium and hydrogen ions.
Inhibits the reabsorption of sodium and chloride in the ascending loop of Henle and distal renal tubule.
